page.title: 04The Broxbourne Lido
page.content: The Broxbourne Lido was completed in 1978 and opened on July 14th. It was built as a part of the Lea Valley Park leisure facility. The Lido is built on a big hill made our of gravel and is built like a raft. The Lido is good fun because there is a wave machine and a slide and fountain. The wave machine goes on every hour and it floods the side of the pool. Every year about 300,000 people come to the Broxbourne Lido and it is really fairly popular. This is probably because of its close proximity to London. The Lido has got a nice play area with climbing frames that goes right down to the river. The busiest time is at weekends, especially Sundays. It is also very busy there in school holidays.
